text:
after 13 years of marriage, I found out my wife was cheating on me, with a guy who was also married himself. I never once came close to cheating our entire marriage. I worked a lot, and bought our house, and paid for just about everything. We have a son together. I appreciated everything she did, raising our child, cleaning the house, etc. But over time, all of that stuff stopped, after about 8 years or so. I started bringing my son to school everyday, and picking him up from my mother in laws house. She stopped cleaning, cooking, etc. Starting going out with friends from work, other mothers from our sons pre school, etc. She even stopped asking me "how do I look?" and didn't even tell me when she was gonna be back home. This went on for awhile. We would have talks sometimes and things would get better for a little while but eventually it would start back up again. 

It really sucks because I loved her so much. I still remember the times when were first in love, and just talked and laughed about everything. I tried everything I could to keep the marriage going, thought I would grow old with her, but, once I found out she was sleeping with this other guy I knew it was over. I wasn't mad....more just really really upset and hurt. This was about 4 years ago now, she is still with that guy that she cheated on me with, (he ended up getting a divorce as well). They seem happy together, but they aren't married, and I am not sure if they ever plan on it. 

I ended up giving her and my son the house, and went and bought a new house right before covid hit. We share custody sort of, she has him full time mostly, I have my don Wednesdays and every other weekend. But now that he is getting older, he just stays home all week lately and I see him on the weekends, but I know real soon he is gonna want to start going out with his friends and stay close to home. That has obviously been the hardest thing about all of this. I don't feel like I lost my son, but man I sure did lose a lot of time with him over the years. I myself am not dating and not looking to probably ever get into another relationship, I am 38 now and well, I just don't see the point, I don't want to go through all of that again I don't think lol. This song is a tough one to get through, I feel like I am the beginning of the video when its her perspective, and it hurts so damn much.

If I were a boy, even just for a day

You don't understand

You'll wish you were a better man

You don't care how it hurts

'Cause you've taken her for granted
And everything you have got destroyed
But you're just a boy

text:
[Verse 1]
If I were a boy
Even just for a day
I'd roll out of bed in the morning
And throw on what I wanted then go
Drink beer with the guys
And chase after girls
I'd kick it with who I wanted
And I'd never get confronted for it
'Cause they'd stick up for me

Chorus]
If I were a boy
I think I could understand
How it feels to love a girl
I swear I'd be a better man
I'd listen to her
'Cause I know how it hurts
When you lose the one you wanted
'Cause he's taken you for granted
And everything you had got destroyed

[Verse 2]
If I were a boy
I would turn off my phone
Tell everyone it's broken
So they'd think that I was sleepin' alone
I'd put myself first
And make the rules as I go
'Cause I know that she'd be faithful
Waitin' for me to come home
To come home

[Chorus]
If I were a boy
I think I could understand, oh-ooh
How it feels to love a girl
I swear I'd be a better man
I'd listen to her
'Cause I know how it hurts
When you lose the one you wanted (Wanted)
'Cause he's taken you for granted (Granted)
And everything you had got destroyed

[Bridge]
It's a little too late for you to come back
Say, it's just a mistake
Think I'd forgive you like that
If you thought I would wait for you
You thought wrong

[Chorus]
But you're just a boy
You don't understand (Yeah, you don't understand, oh)
How it feels to love a girl
Someday, you'll wish you were a better man
You don't listen to her
You don't care how it hurts
Until you lose the one you wanted
'Cause you've taken her for granted
And everything you have got destroyed

[Outro]
But you're just a boy

text:
Beyoncé’s unmatched accomplishments include, being 5x Oscar nominated, performing for the Oscar’s 3x, 8 Primetime Emmy Nominations. Beyoncé has officially become the most awarded Artist of ALL TIME. Most Grammys won by ANY singer or rapper, Most NAACP awards won  with 25 wins. Won the Michael Jackson Video Vangaurd Award, Won the Vanguard songwriter of the year award. Inducted into the GWR Hall Of Fame. FIRST woman to EVER headline Glastonbury, headlined Coachella, Headlined the Super Bowl TWICE, personally chosen to tribute Legends such as Michael Jackson, Tina Turner, Babarra Streisand, Stevie Wonder, Kobe Bryant. Sung on stage with the iconic Prince, sung on stage with the great Celine Dion. Beyoncé has sung for the President, Sung for the Presidents Dance. Now to her statistical musical accolades, Beyonce is the first female artist to have all 7 of her solo studio albums debut at No1 on the Billboard 200. At 22 her first Solo album Dangerously In Love debuted at no1, she became the FIRST female artist to top both the singles and albums charts simultaneously in the United States and the United Kingdom. Beyoncé is the first woman and only the third performer ever, outside of Paul McCartney and Michael Jackson, to have at least 20 Top 10 songs as a solo artist and at least 10 Top 10 songs on the Billboard Hot 100. Her 2nd Album Bday produced 4 top 10 hits and ‘check up on it’ which topped at No1 for 5 weeks. Her fifth album ‘Beyonce’ became the fastest-selling album ever on iTunes, both in the US and worldwide after just 3 days of sales.
Her Legendary Emmy nominated album Lemonade charted on the Billboard Hot 100 becoming the FIRST female artist to ever have 12 or more songs on the chart at the same time.  Lemonade also debuted at Number 1 on the Official Albums chart. At 41 and after a 6 year absence, her latest album Renaissance was the second biggest 2022 album debut by a female artist and the third-biggest overall. All 16 songs from the album made to the billboard hot 100, with break my soul hitting No1, this is without any visual music videos and very limited promotion. Of course this Is just a light summary of her unmatched greatness.
author: Dee Vasquez
